newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: SOCCER-BENFICA OUST CHAMPIONS PORTO FROM TOP SPOT.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BENFICA OUST CHAMPIONS PORTO FROM TOP SPOT.

text.p: Benfica ousted Portuguese champions Porto from the top of the table when they beat bottom-placed Uniao de Leiria 2-0 away on Sunday.
Portugal's top three, Benfica, Sporting and Porto are now level with 10 points each but Benfica, who suffered a humiliating 5-0 defeat to Porto in the midweek Supercup final, lead on goal difference.
Benfica, who meet Poland's Ruch Chorzow in the second leg of the European Cup Winner's Cup on Thursday, had a lukewarm first half devoid of real goal chances.
But they opened the scoring in the 75th minute when Romanian midfielder Nica Panduru finished a solo effort whihc started from outside the area.
The Lisbon team sealed their victory three minutes from the final whistle with a goal by Brazilian striker Osmar Donizete after a cross from compatriot Valdo Filho.
Porto, who play Gothenburg of Sweden in the European Champion's League on Wednesday, won 1-0 at Salgueiros on Saturday.
Sporting beat Maritimo 3-0 at home on Friday ahead of the UEFA Cup match against France's Montpellier on Tuesday in Lisbon after 1-1 draw in the first leg.
